body_html:
@sunnysuhappy i think you were previously trying tf.contrib.layers alike. If that is the case, then you can add a statement import tensorflow.contrib as contrib, after that, the auto completion of PyCharm can work, at least this works for me, you can have a try! ^_^

@jubjamie But i notice that contrib is only an attibute of tf while others are not (take nn for example, nn tf.nn is a module). So, can you make contrib act like nn ?
body_text:
@sunnysuhappy i think you were previously trying tf.contrib.layers alike. If that is the case, then you can add a statement import tensorflow.contrib as contrib, after that, the auto completion of PyCharm can work, at least this works for me, you can have a try! ^_^
@jubjamie But i notice that contrib is only an attibute of tf while others are not (take nn for example, nn tf.nn is a module). So, can you make contrib act like nn ?
body:
@sunnysuhappy i think you were previously trying `tf.contrib.layers` alike. If that is the case, then you can add a statement `import tensorflow.contrib as contrib`, after that, the auto completion of PyCharm can work, at least this works for me, you can have a try! ^_^

@jubjamie But i notice that contrib is only an attibute of tf while others are not (take nn for example, nn tf.nn is a module). So, can you make contrib act like nn ?
